FU.Title: Title
FU.ExpMaxHint: Sets the maximum amount of EXP required to level up (default is 10).
FU.InlineRollCheck: Roll an attribute check on the selected actors. Hold SHIFT to configure the check beforehand.
FU.InlineRecovery: Apply resource recovery to selected token
FU.InlineLoss: Apply resource loss to selected tokens
FU.InlineWeapon: Apply effect to equipped weapon on character
FU.InlineDamageType: Alter damage type {type} to {affinity} on character
FU.Name: Name
FU.EquipWeapon:
Equip Item

[Right Click] Equip to Off-Hand
[Ctrl+Click] Equip to Phantom Hand
FU.UnequipWeapon:
Unequip Item

[Right Click] Unequip from Off-Hand
[Ctrl+Click] Unequip from Phantom Hand

Equip Item
[Left Click] Equip to Main-Hand
[Right Click] Equip to Off-Hand
FU.UnequipArmor:
Unequip Item
[Left Click] Unequip from Main-Hand
[Right Click] Unequip from Off-Hand
FU.IncreaseTooltip:
[Left Click] Increase by 1
[Right Click] Increase by Step
FU.DecreaseTooltip:

[Right Click] Decrease by Step
FU.PasteEffectPrompt: Insert copied Inline Effect below (only base64 supported):
FU.EmotionDescribeLabel: Explain why your views shifted towards bond.
FU.CoverRule:
Until the start of your next turn:
  • You are covered by another creature, preventing enemies from making melee attacks against you.
FU.FlyingRule: Grounded foes cannot melee attack you mid-air.
FU.EnragedRule: Reduce Dexterity and Insight die size by 1.
FU.PoisonedRule: Reduce Might and Willpower die size by 1.
FU.CrisisRule: Triggers when your current HP is half or lower than your Maximum HP (rounded down).
FU.AttackRule: You perform a melee or ranged attack.
FU.SpellRule: You cast one of the spells you have learned.
FU.EquipmentRule: Switch any number of equipped items with any number of items in your backpack (except Armor).
FU.GuardRule:
Only once per turn. Until the start of your next turn:
  • You gain Resistance to all damage types.
  • You gain a +2 bonus to Opposed Checks.
  • You may @EFFECT[cover] another creature and prevent foes from performing melee attacks against them.
FU.StudyRule: You attempt to gain information about someone or something. Usually an 【INS + INS】 Open Check. Can’t ask the same question twice.
FU.InventoryRule: Spend Inventory Points to produce and immediately use a consumable item.
FU.HinderRule: You perform a Check (DL 10) against an Opponent. If you succeed, inflict @EFFECT[dazed], @EFFECT[shaken], @EFFECT[slow] or @EFFECT[weak] against them.
FU.ObjectiveRule:
Work towards accomplishing an objective within the conflict.
  • Requires an Attribute Check or Opposed Check.
  • Complex Goals often require a Clock.
FU.SkillRule: Some Skills require you to spend an Action. Out of combat, Skills generally require 5-10 seconds.
FU.OpportunitiesHint: When assigned, will be prompted as choices for the users.
FU.ChatActiveEffectDeleted: The selected active effect has been deleted
FU.AutomationManageEffectsHint: Whether active effect durations and more are managed during combat
FU.AutomationRemoveExpiredEffectsHint: Whether active effect durations and more are managed during combat
FU.AutomationEffectsReminderHint: Whether to post chat messages as effect durations decrease
FU.AutomationApplyDamageHint: Automatically apply damage from actions when possible
FU.UseEquipmentHint: This feature allows npcs to use equipment
FU.ChatActorOwnershipWarning: You cannot perform that action on that actor as you do not own it.
FU.ExperimentalCombatTrackerHint: Experimental combat tracker featuring back and forth initiative.
FU.DialogDefeatedTurnContent: You are about to take a turn with a defeated combatant. Do you want to continue?
FU.GroupCheckCancelDialogContent: Do you really want to cancel this {type}?
FU.GroupCheckAlreadySupported: You already supported this Group Check.
FU.GroupCheckLeaderCantSupport: The leader can't also support the Group Check.
FU.CombatTakeTurnOutOfTurn: [Shift + Click] to use a turn outside of the normal turn order
FU.OptionalFeatureDialogChangeTypeContent: Do you really want to change the type of this optional feature? Your previously entered data will be lost.
FU.ClassFeatureDialogChangeTypeContent: Do you really want to change the type of this class feature? Your previously entered data will be lost.
FU.ClassFeatureAlchemyRollTableMissing: You must set the target and effect rollable tables in the configuration of this class feature in order for the automation to work.
FU.ClassFeatureAlchemyRollTableExplanation: Rollable Tables are expected to have exactly 20 possible results.
FU.ClassFeatureToneDescriptionTooltip: You can use 'key.type', 'key.status', 'key.attribute' and 'key.recovery' to refer to a verses key by wrapping them in '@DATA[ ]'. You can also refer to attribute die sizes by using 'attribute.dex', 'attribute.ins', 'attribute.mig' and 'attribute.wlp' the same way.
FU.ClassFeatureVerseVolumeLowTargets: Yourself or another creature you can see who can hear you.
FU.ClassFeatureVerseVolumeMediumTargets: Every ally who can hear you.
FU.ClassFeatureVerseVolumeHighTargets: Every enemy who can hear you.
FU.ClassFeatureDanceDurationNextTurn: Until the start of your next turn
FU.ChatApplySelectedTooltip: Click to apply effect to selected tokens.
FU.ChatApplyNoCharacterSelected: No character selected. Unable to apply.
FU.ChatApplyEffectNoActorsSelected: No actors selected. Unable to apply effect.
FU.ChatApplyEffectNoActorsTargeted: No actors targeted. Unable to apply effect.
FU.ChatApplyDamageTooltip:
Click to apply {amount} {type} damage to selected tokens.
[Ctrl + Click] to Open Damage Customizer
[Shift + Click] to ignore Resistances.
[Ctrl + Shift] + Click to ignore Resistances and Immunities.
FU.ChatApplyDamageNoActorsSelected: No actors selected. Unable to apply damage.
FU.ChatApplyDamageNormal: {actor} was dealt {type} damage and lost {damage} {resource} from {from}
FU.ChatApplyDamageImmune: {actor} was immune to {type} and took {damage} damage from {from}
FU.ChatApplyDamageAbsorb: {actor} absorbed {type} damage from {from} and was healed by {damage} HP
FU.ChatApplyResourceLossTooltip: Click to spend the given resource on the actor who performed this action.

FU.ChatFumbleOpportunity: The opposition of {actor} gets to apply the effects of an opportunity!

FU.UsedSPExtraInitiativeBonus: Used skills from extra initiative bonus
FU.UsedSPExtraAccuracyCheck: Used skills from extra accuracy check
FU.UsedSPExtraMagicCheck: Used skills from extra magic check
FU.RecoveryDescriptionTooltip:
To add Damage or Restoration effects, use '@DMG[numeric affinity]' or '@HEAL[numeric hp/mp/ip]'.
Example: 'A creature recovers 50 Hit Points.' can be written as 'A creature recovers @HEAL[ 50 hp]'.
Commands must be presented in chat in English. They will be translated when computed.
FU.InventoryPointRecoveryMessage: {actor} found useful items worth {amount} IP because of {from}
FU.RestingEffects:
Fully Restored: All Hit Points and Mind Points replenished.
All status effects cleared.
FU.RestingEffectsIP:
Fully Restored: All Hit Points, Mind Points, and Inventory replenished.
All status effects cleared.
FU.NoPermission: Skipped applying {from} to {actor}. No permission to update this actor.
FU.DragAndDropHowTo: To apply, Drag & Drop this element onto an Actor Sheet or Token you control.
FU.ExperimentalCombatHudSettingsHint: Enable to use combat HUD which features a UI to track attributes and status effects.
FU.ExperimentalCombatHudInstuction: Choose your preferred options for the Combat HUD.
FU.ExperimentalCombatHudWarningNoCombatTrac: Experimental Combat HUD requires the Experimental Combat Tracker to be enabled. Do you want to enable it?
FU.CombatHudPanTokenSettings: Disable Pan to Token for Combat Tracker
FU.CombatHudPanTokenSettingsHint: Enable this option to prevent panning to the token when clicking on a combatant in the Combat Tracker.
FU.CombatHudOpacityHint: Adjust the opacity of the Combat HUD.
FU.CombatHudWidthHint: Adjust the width of the Combat HUD.
FU.CombatHudPositionButtonHint: Adjust the position of the Combat HUD's button position
FU.CombatHudPositionHint: Adjust the position of the Combat HUD.
FU.ChatEndScene: End the current scene, dispatching a notification event.
FU.ChatMessageOptionsSettingsInstuction: Decide how you want to customize chat messages.
FU.ChatMessageHideTagsHint: Choose how the Tags will be displayed.
FU.ChatMessageHideDescriptionHint: Choose how chat descriptions on weapons, items, spells and abilities will be shown.
FU.ChatMessageHideQualityHint: Choose how quality descriptions will be shown.
FU.ChatMessageHideRollDetailsHint: Choose how extra roll details (each die results and modifiers) will be shown.
FU.ChatMessageCollapseDescriptionHint: Chat descriptions on weapons, items, spells and abilities will be collapsed by default.
FU.OptionalRulesSettingsInstuction: Decide what optional rules you would like to include in your world.

FU.BehaviorRollsManageHint: Manage the Behavior Roll mechanic based on Random Targeting.

FU.BehaviorRollsSettingsHint: Play with the Random Targeting rule from Core Rulebook page 297.
FU.TotalPartyMemberSettingsHint: How many party members are currently in your party for target priority.
FU.TotalPartyMemberRulesSettingsHint: Add target priority to all item rolls.
FU.DefaultTargetingModeHint: Choose what type of targeting is prioritized when clicking an in-line effect. Game user refers to character selected in "User Configuration".
FU.StudySavePathSettingsHint: Name of the folder to save newly studied NPCs into.
FU.RevisedStudyRollSettingsHint: Enable this option to use revised Study Roll [7/10/13] from Fabula Ultima Playtest Materials.
FU.PixelatedViewSettingsHint: Enable this option to render 16-bit art in a viewable manner, preserving its retro aesthetic with minimal scaling artifacts.
FU.AlwaysFavoriteSettingsHint: Enable this option to always favorite an item during creation.
FU.NotesTabSettingsHint: Add the biography & info notes tab into the NPC Sheet.
FU.EffectCrisisInteractionActiveTooltip: This effect will become active when the Actor goes into Crisis.
FU.EffectCrisisInteractionInactiveTooltip: This effect will stay inactive as long as the Actor is in Crisis.

FU.CombatHudEffectsMarqueeModeHint: Choose the mode of the effects marquee cycle in the Combat HUD.
FU.CombatHudReorderingHint: Enable this option to allow reordering of combatants in the Combat HUD.

FU.ConfigMetaCurrencySettingsHint: Manage how the Meta-Currency Tracker calculates Experience.
FU.ConfigMetaCurrencyBaseExperienceHint: The amount of experience a character earns per session before bonuses from spent Fabula or Ultima points.
FU.ConfigMetaCurrencyKeepExcessFabulaHint: Keep excess Fabula points, if they cannot be evenly distributed between active characters.
FU.CombatHudPopoutNotInstalled: The 'PopOut!' module is required for this functionality.

FU.SettingChecksV2Hint: Activate the new (and hopefully improved) Check implementation. Be sure to report bugs you find.

FU.ConfigMetaCurrencyAutomationHint: With this enabled, whenever a Fabula or Ultima point is spent the Meta-Currency tracker will automatically be updated. For this to work a GM needs to be online. Direct editing of the Fabula/Ultima point field will not change the tracker.
FU.MetaCurrencyAutomationNoActiveGm: No GM online! Unable to update the Meta-Currency tracker.
FU.ConfigMetaCurrencyAutomaticallyDistribut: With this option enabled the session EXP will automatically be awarded to each active character.

FU.ClassFeatureMagiseedGrowthClockNoMatchin: Filled clock sections do not correspond to an effect.

Unknown Effect! Generate it using the Delicacy Effect table and don't forget to save it in your cookbook.

FU.CombatHudTurnIconsHint: The following settings let you customize the turn icons used by the Combat HUD. You can use any valid icon name from Google's {materialSymbolsLink} icons. Before saving changes, please be sure the preview for each icon is correct.

FU.CombatHudTurnIconsOutOfTurnsHint: Icon displayed for a combatant that has no turns remaining.
FU.CombatHudTurnIconsTurnsLeftHiddenHint: Icon displayed for NPC combatants when their remaining turns are not shown. See also: "NPC Turns Left Mode".

FU.SheetOptionsHint: Configure various options for the system's sheets.

FU.CombatHudResetPositionHint: Will reset the position of the combat HUD back to default.
FU.AutomaticAdversaryRegistrationHint: Whether to automatically register adversaries to the party sheet in combat
FU.OptionTechnospheresHint: Enables the Technosphere rules from Techno Fantasy Atlas p130. Armor and Custom Weapons will have slots instead of qualities. Hoplospheres, Mnemospheres and Mnemosphere Receptacles can be created.
FU.TechnospheresSlottingErrorNotTechnospher: Only Technospheres can be slotted in this item.
FU.TechnospheresSlottingErrorMnemosphereOnl: Only Mnemospheres can be slotted in this item.
FU.TechnospheresSlottingErrorWeaponOnly: This Hoplosphere can only be slotted into weapons.
FU.HoplosphereIdLine1: Be aware that changing this value has consequences for how the system handles Hoplospheres.
FU.HoplosphereIdLine2: Coagulation levels, and thus active coagulation effects, are determined by counting socketed Hoplospheres with the same FUID.
FU.HoplosphereTooltipSocketableWeaponOnly: Can only be slotted into weapons
FU.HoplosphereEffectImproveAttributeSummary: Increase the {attribute} die size by one step.
FU.HoplosphereEffectChangeWeaponDamageTypeS: Causes the weapon to deal {damageType} damage.
FU.CrisisMultiplierHint: Multiplier used to calculate base Crisis Score
FU.EventRelationHint: The context in which the the character fits in the event
FU.FactionRelationHint: The targets' faction relation with the character
FU.SelectorHint: Determines which characters is the rule element executed on.
FU.AutomationRuleElementsHint: Whether to enable rule element automation
FU.RuleElementTriggered: The triggering condition has been satisfied.
FU.IncubationWarning: The following feature is currently incubating and there may be issues present. Please bear that in mind.
FU.SkillConditionMet: The condition for this skill has been met.

FUID.ChangeWarning2: Changing an Item's Fabula Ultima ID might break references to the Item! Proceed with caution and only if you are sure.

FU.OptionPressureSystemHint: Enables the Pressure and Stagger system.
FU.OptionPressureGaugeShowHint: Whether to show the pressure gauge on tokens in the canvas.
FU.OptionPressureGaugePositionHint: Where to place the pressure gauge relative to the token.
FU.OptionPressureGaugeThemeHint: What theme to use for the pressure gauge.

FU.CompendiumMigrateActorItemsMessage: Would you like to migrate the data in the matching items ({count}) of the actor to that of the compendium?
